Package main

Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • main.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class to define the JPanel and run the majority of the code.
    Author:
    Daniel Falcone
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GamePanel()
      GamePanel constructor which creates the ball, paddles, score, key listener, and the thread for the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void createBall()
      Creates the ball and spawns it at a random Y value along the middle of the screen.
      void createPaddle()
      Creates the paddles at opposite ends of the screen.
      void detectCollision()
      Detects collision between the paddles and the screen edges, and the paddles and the ball.
      void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the paddles, ball, and score.
      Paddle getPaddle1()
      Gets the paddle on the left.
      Paddle getPaddle2()
      Gets the paddle on the right.
      void move()
      Calls move methods for the paddles and the ball
      void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Paint method used to display the graphics onto the screen.
      void run()
      Method from runnable that executes the game loop.

    • Field Detail

      • GAME_WIDTH

        private static final int GAME_WIDTH
        Integer to define width of the panel.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GAME_HEIGHT

        private static final int GAME_HEIGHT
        Integer to define the height of the panel. 0.5555 is the ratio of the width to length of a standard ping pong table (5/9).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
